subject: Swimming
Medicine and Health
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: The swimmer Eric Shanteau had surgery Wednesday to remove a cancerous testicle after fulfilling his goal of swimming in the Olympics. The 24-year-old Shanteau had the operation at Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, his agent Evan Morgenstein said. Shanteau, who grew up in suburban Atlanta, was found to have cancer in June, shortly before the United States Olympic trials. Shanteau made his first Olympic team, beating out the former world-record holder Brendan Hansen in the 200-meter breaststroke. With his doctors approval, he competed in the Beijing Games, but he did not advance to the final of his event.
